```{r, echo = FALSE, fig.cap="Binomial Probabiltiy Mass Function"}
x = 0:4

fill_1 = rgb(0, 0.3, 0.8, 0.25)
fill_0 = rgb(0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)

barplot(
  dbinom(x, size = 4, prob = 0.75), 
  col = c(fill_0, fill_0, fill_0, fill_1, fill_0), 
  space = 0, names.arg = 0:4,
  xlab = "success count")
```

<div class="questionborder">
### Q1: 2 pts

- What is the probability of observing a count of *exactly* 3 successes in a binomial distribution with parameters n = 4 and p = 0.75?
- Paste the R code that you used to find your answer.

</div>





Solution
========

0.42

This is the code they should have used:

```{r}
dbinom(x = 3, size = 4, p = 0.75)
```

They may have tried some of the following:
```{r}
dbinom(x = 1, size = 4, p = 0.75)
dbinom(x = 2, size = 4, p = 0.75)
dbinom(x = 3, size = 4, p = 0.75)
dbinom(x = 4, size = 4, p = 0.75)
```
